snippet: After regulation, seven overtimes and a 1-1 tie, the Ohio high school hockey state championship game was halted by state officials and the competing teams were declared co-champions.
abstract: Frustration abounds as Ohio state championship final in ice hockey is declared a 1-1 tie after Cleveland St Ignatius and Sylvania Northview play seven overtime periods; rules for high school hockey do not provide for shootouts to break ties.
lead_paragraph: After regulation, seven overtimes and a 1-1 tie, the Ohio high school hockey state championship game was halted by state officials and the competing teams were declared co-champions.

headline.seo: Ohio High School Hockey Championship Game Ends in Tie
headline.main: Game With No Winner Ends in Shared Title
headline.print_headline: Game With No Winner Ends in Shared Title
